Description: Fragment from rim of pottery Megarian bowl. Mould-made relief decoration under the lip with imbricated rows of lotus petals, each filled with three vertical dashes. Black slip much worn off on exterior.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 133, pl. XL, no. 375.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ID.004) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5865 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
